newsitem.title: USA: Glynn Wolfe, world's most-married man, dies at 88.
newsitem.headline: Glynn Wolfe, world's most-married man, dies at 88.

text.p: Glynn Wolfe, who had the dubious distinction of being listed as the world's most-married man, has died at the age of 88, a county coroner's spokesman said on Thursday.
Wolfe, married 29 times and listed in the Guinness Book of Records, died of coronary artery disease at a nursing home in San Bernardino on June 10, spokesman Tom Dewhirst said.
But the 29th Mrs. Wolfe, whom he married in June 1996, will not be there to grieve at his funeral, Dewhirst said.

"There will be no funeral, no burial service, no headstone, no nothing," he said, explaining that the widow, Linda Essex-Wolfe, had said the family was indigent and had asked the county to accept disposition of the body.
Wolfe will be cremated and his ashes placed in an unmarked grave in the county cemetery, Dewhirst said.

He died 10 days before he and his wife were to celebrate their first anniversary. Essex-Wolfe was to travel from her home in Indiana to celebrate the event and the couple had planned to reaffirm their vows. They had never lived together.
Their marriage -- it was Essex-Wolfe's 23rd, making her the world's most-married woman -- was a hyped affair arranged by the National Enquirer supermarket tabloid.
Wolfe is survived by 19 children, about 40 grandchildren and 19 great-grandchildren.
